cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 129 (Wednesday, July 26, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. CHU:H.R. 4897.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 3 of Article 1, Section 8 of the United StatesConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:To direct the Secretary of Labor to promulgate anoccupational safety and health standard to protect workersfrom heat-related injuries and illnesses.[Page H4031]

item.title: Asunción Valdivia Heat Illness, Injury, and Fatality Prevention Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

bill.title: Asunción Valdivia Heat Illness, Injury, and Fatality Prevention Act of 2023

item.title: Asunción Valdivia Heat Illness, Injury, and Fatality Prevention Act of 2023
Asunción Valdivia Heat Illness, Injury, and Fatality Prevention Act of 2023
To direct the Secretary of Labor to promulgate an occupational safety and health standard to protect workers from heat-related injuries and illnesses.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
